This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"boostYield(uint256,(uint256,uint8,uint256,bytes32,bytes))":{"params":{"nftId":"The NFT ID to add collateral to (caller must own this NFT).","priceQuery":"The signed price attestation for the current ETH/USD price."}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address)":{"params":{"_admin":"The address to receive admin and upgrader roles.","_cuspdToken":"The address of the cUSPDToken contract.","_oracle":"The address of the PriceOracle contract.","_rateContract":"The address of the PoolSharesConversionRate contract.","_stabilizerNFT":"The address of the StabilizerNFT contract."}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"updateDependencies(address,address,address,address)":{"details":"Callable only by admin."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."}},"title":"RewardsYieldBooster","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"boostYield(uint256,(uint256,uint8,uint256,bytes32,bytes))":{"notice":"Receives ETH, boosts the system yield, and deposits the ETH as collateral."},"getSurplusYield()":{"notice":"Returns the total surplus yield factor accumulated from contributions."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address)":{"notice":"Initializes the contract with its dependencies."},"updateDependencies(address,address,address,address)":{"notice":"Updates the addresses of core contract dependencies."}},"notice":"A contract to handle surplus collateral contributions to boost the overall system JJMFvcQPA1PfMpe6GLd7kbdC9tUhve81R1VT5ezN"]}},"version":1}

params.nftId: The NFT ID to add collateral to (caller must own this NFT).
params.priceQuery: The signed price attestation for the current ETH/USD price.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params._admin: The address to receive admin and upgrader roles.
params._cuspdToken: The address of the cUSPDToken contract.
params._oracle: The address of the PriceOracle contract.
params._rateContract: The address of the PoolSharesConversionRate contract.
params._stabilizerNFT: The address of the StabilizerNFT contract.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

boostYield(uint256,(uint256,uint8,uint25.notice: Receives ETH, boosts the system yield, and deposits the ETH as collateral.

getSurplusYield().notice: Returns the total surplus yield factor accumulated from contributions.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: Initializes the contract with its dependencies.

updateDependencies(address,address,addre.notice: Updates the addresses of core contract dependencies.
